posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Mage-Fist

Image source: https://img5.goodfon.com/wallpaper/nbig ... ia-mag.jpg


This class combination attempts to marry great parts of each class, and somehow the stats look quite nice.

Sorcerer 25 for spellpower, ie summons, damage shields, ILMS/IGMS, stoneskin/greater stoneskin/premonition, improved invisibility, BBoD, greater sanc, time stop, mords, epic mage armor, epic warding
Monk 5 for Monk UBAB, evasion, 5-7 APR, 
RDD 10 for very solid strength gains, AC gains, and other gains.
Manually took knockdown to avoid waiting till lvl 40 odd for the free feat.

Ends up with Base 38 Strength (cap-able to 50), Base AB 40, nearly 400 HP, 13 bonus AC, 200+ skill points etc.

Had a look in the ECB archives, the most similar build being The Zen Spellblade (Sorc 26/Monk 4/RDD 10) which is a Kama user 2 less AB 4 less Str 40 less hp and 2 more AC.

In the ECB Tapatalk Forum, Empyre65 has his Order of the Wyrm build which is a much stronger 'Monk' than Sorc. 

Fists which do 1-20 damage and mind immunity for example, are sorely missed here! 

It also has 11 more AC, which I have attempted to compensate with the sorcerer spell kit including epic mage armor.

Anyway looked pretty cool to me, thought I would share this one, see if you guys had any interest / suggested tweaks.

Theres something cool about a monk who wanders around with extended expedious retreat, flings out 3-4 fireballs, casts Time Stop/Mords then eliminates the enemy mage, with damage shields and Epic Warding up then proceeds to beat up the enemy with 50 str fists....


Image source: https://i.pinimg.com/originals/9a/a4/44 ... 236fc2.jpg


SpoilerSorcerer(25), Monk(5), Red Dragon Disciple(10), Human STR: 16 (38) CON: 14 (16) INT: 12 (14) 01: Monk(1): Toughness, Blind Fight, {Cleave, Evasion, Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning Fist} 03: Monk(2): Weapon Focus: Unarmed, {Deflect Arrows} 05: Sorcerer(3) 07: Monk(3) 09: Sorcerer(6): Craft Wand 11: Sorcerer(8) 13: Red Dragon Disciple(2): (STR=21) 15: Red Dragon Disciple(4): Knockdown, (STR=23) 17: Monk(4) 19: Red Dragon Disciple(7): (CON=16) 21: Red Dragon Disciple(9): Epic Weapon Focus: Unarmed, (INT=14) 23: Sorcerer(9) 25: Sorcerer(11) 27: Sorcerer(13): Great Strength II, (STR=32) 29: Sorcerer(15) 31: Sorcerer(17) 33: Sorcerer(19): Great Strength IV, (STR=35) 35: Sorcerer(21) 37: Sorcerer(23): Epic Spell: Epic Warding 39: Sorcerer(25): Great Strength V, (STR=37) Skillpoints: 207 Saving Throw bonuses: Spells: +7, Mind Effects: +2 AB (max, naked): 40 (melee), 22 (ranged) Spell Casting: Sorcerer(9) 01: Concentration(4), Discipline(4), Listen(4), Lore(4), Open Lock(1), Save(6),  03: Concentration(1), Discipline(2), Listen(2), Lore(1), Tumble(5), Save(3),  05: Concentration(1), Lore(1), Save(7),  07: Concentration(1), Discipline(4), Listen(4), Tumble(5), Save(2),  09: Concentration(1), Save(8),  11: Concentration(1), Save(14),  13: Concentration(1), Discipline(1), Listen(1), Save(4),  15: Concentration(1), Discipline(1), Listen(1), Save(6),  17: Concentration(1), Discipline(1), Listen(1), Tumble(10),  19: Concentration(1), Discipline(1), Listen(1), Search(1),  21: Concentration(1), Discipline(1), Listen(1), Search(2),  23: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(4),  25: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(4),  27: Concentration(1), Save(7),  29: Concentration(1), Save(15),  31: Concentration(1), Save(23),  33: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(4), Save(23),  35: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(4), Save(23),  37: Concentration(1), Save(28),  39: Concentration(1), Save(36),

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Problem is, those Fists suffer from low damage (not enough Monk levels to get to 1d20).  It is "only" 1d8.

Of course, Str will add to that damage - but with moar Monk, that would be even more damage!

Also, Fists cannot be FWed or GMWed...so that would probably just leave one with TT (Though BS, CG, etc buffs are nice!).

A general "problem" with Fist monks.

As this will be a Str build, AC will suffer (not that there was a chance to nail down the Dex AC with UD).

Then there is the AC "dilemma" - I guess one could go full Damage Shields and Pre/SH/GrSk. 

I have looked into doing this - I just did not like the results that much.  It is nice to damage with Str (I would go Kama with this build, personally) - and RDD brings the pain!  Sorc levels are nice, high, and juicy, with the right spell choices will definitely be a factor.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Web for the feedback. Great to hear you have been working on a similar project yourself.

1d8 is the same as a standard longsword :) 
Combined with a Warrior's AB, and up to 50 Strength, I see no problem here, continue moving along now...

I could get the 1-20 damage fists with the build but I would have to drop RDD and go Sorc 24/Monk 16. I would probably want to go dexterity based then. Or drop spellcasting and play Empyre65's build. He has already done all the ground work, no need to reinvent the wheel if you really want those 1-20 damage fists. 

I didn't like Kama because it can get disarmed as a small weapon pretty easily and sometimes one gets sick of equipping em. 

I have ignored dex AC due to the build not having uncanny dodge.

It has heaps of spells starting from summons at level 2, improved invisibility, empowered and extended spell buffs and ending with Epic Mage Armor to help compensate for this.

I also did not pump it particularly high for the option of damage shields. 

That being said, the build gets +13 AC from Tumble (8), RDD (4) and Monk (1). 

I adjusted the build for a Sorc 25 / Monk 5 / RDD 10 split, I just took knockdown manually, its too long to wait till lvl 40 to have that feat. 

It does have potentially lots of Bigby spell castings, but I am wary of spell resistant opponents.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
Not to dissuade you, I like the build. But to further Webs point, in NWN, you do not get Enhancement bonuses on gloves, just Attack bonuses. The reason fists can climb to 1d20 is to attempt to balance (+5 1d20+0 20x2) them against the (+5 1d8+5 19-20 x2) longsword. It works to a degree, until you drop keen, flaming, paly spells, etc on the longsword ... then not so much.

Still, I have been playing a bunch with fist builds, Web peaked my interest in them again ... and hell an RDD can punch most stuff to death without the monk bonuses :)


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
If you want to keen/flame/GMW the weapon a very viable alternative is just to change the weapon focus to greatsword or halberd and dish out the pain.

You drop the APR from 5-7 to 3-4 and lose deflect arrows but get 1.5 str damage. Which is great here.

Or go kama if you really want.

I don't see a problem.

Fists are good, combined with a warriors AB and RDD's strength and a full sorc spellbook, very nice.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
It is less a problem than just ensuring an educated decision and you asked for feedback. 1d8 fists are nothing like a 1d8 longsword. There are lots of things that can and are applied to a longsword or any weapon which invalidate the comparison. A comparison that looks viable on the surface until you understand how fists work,.

If you do understand and choose to proceed with the fist build you want, great. I am just offering clarification and making sure to articulate and define why 1d20 fist barely compare to a 1d8 longsword and, more importantly ... why. Or, as I like to say, fists are kinda fubar in NWN and the attempt to correct/balance them just make them more difficult to understand :)

So, all good, I have no personal preference or ask here, just wanting to ensure it all makes sense is all.


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
No need to be defensive.
I am interested in ways to improve the build. The 1d20 fists belong to a different build.

There are pros and cons between using fists vs kamas vs two handed.

Web has suggested Kama. Very valid choice.
I liked fists. Mostly with bludgeoning damage / not disarmable and theme wise.
Both are viable.
There's 40 base melee AB and 38-50 Str.

I wasnt sure i understood your own preference.
Did you prefer kama too or two handed? Or fists here if you were to play the build.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
I do not have a preference and I am not meaning to be defensive I do not really have a horse in the race as it were, my goal is just to provide the basic info to make an educated decision. I just meant to expand on what web said a bit to provide more clarity.

On a build front, I struggle with shoehorning a melee build into an arcane framework in NWN. They always seem really awkward for me to play as a true merge. Either you cast or you fight, you cannot do both in NWN and both are offensive classes. So when I merge them, I tend to be very specific goal orientated. Meaning I may add sorcercer for animal buffs and damage shield to my melee kinda approach ... but it is a melee build. Or, I may add quick movement and move cap breakage to my caster build ... but it is a caster build.

I would probably end up treating this build as a straight caster, nullifying most of the value of it I suspect.

In summary, I struggle to play these properly and so I also struggle with that exact preference ... If you pushed me for a choice, I would go single Kama probably and that based entirely on a kama to unarmed comparison at a weapon/damage level on a non-full melee build.


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Another tweak might be to include dev crit in the build.

By dropping toughness and one of empower spell/craft wand or blind fight for power attack and great cleave.

Then drop two great strengths for overwhelming and devastating critical.

One loses 1 AB 2 Str 1 damage, HP and metamagic feat/blind fight for the privilege.

Any thoughts / opinions? The 50 Str is nice though. I would miss it!

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Spellswords (spell fist in this case) are great in many ways, you get to experience and learn about two classes at once...

A fence sitter!!! Surely there are rules against that here hehe... it's always win / win to give your opinion! Always happy to learn something

Edit: noted the ninja edit! Thanks Zanithar!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Well, as I said, I was looking into this - and the Kama route just makes more sense.

Compare 1d8 Fist + Str (+AB from gloves, perhaps).

With

Kama 1d6+Str, can be GMW+FW, can also be + AB AND Damage.

The 1d2 difference is...very, very small.

That is why I suggest Kama(s). Btw - you can FoB with Kama(s).

Sent from my SM-G955F using Tapatalk

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
Also, theme wise, fists rock ...


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
There aren't a lot of great monk portraits wielding kamas - at least I found two nice ones with fists!

I also found a few awesome quarterstaff arcane monk pics... with all that STR in the build it could definitely work in my opinion!

Surely availability of good portraits counts towards the viability of builds!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I like this spellsword spellfist build, if nothing else for it's high AB.
It is well put together.
Spell DC is not a priority with charisma 19, so you will often have to rely on non-save spells.
Spell penetration will pierce SR 26 every time, but you will need Breach/ Mord to improve penetration against more resistent  foes.
The low AC may pose a problem, but it can be solved if you have wisdom and dexterity gear and buff with empowered owl's and cat's.
A sorcerer 24/ monk 6/ RDD 10 split is tempting. You retain undispellability, get slightly weaker penetration, but get an extra mid epic skill dump. KD/IKD is not so important as long as you can spam Bigby VI. Anyway, dropping KD would free up a pre epic feat slot. Maximise would add to spontaneous caster flexibility.
I would consider a slightly different pre epic leveling order: 1) Monk (1), 7) Monk (2), 12) Monk (3) and 17) Monk (4).
It delays the first tumble dump, but you get spells (among them Ghostly visage and Stoneskin) and the first RDD level one level earlier.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Mick for your awesome suggestions.
Figuring out ways to mitigate against the low AC issue early on was a priority for me.
I take sorc 1 early for the summons but pushing sorc higher earlier makes it even easier to level.
I did initially put maximise in but took it out for knockdown because of SR fears. As you rightly point out there are ways around it. I probably need to work on practicing lowering spell resistance of opponents more with mords and breaches

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I probably need to work on practicing lowering spell resistance of opponents more with mords and breaches
That is a great idea!

Lesser Breach (and Empowered LB!) is a great spell for a Sorcerer until they get a level high enough to do Greater Breach!

And, of course, the King, Mord's!

Sent from my SM-G955F using Tapatalk

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Does anyone know if the SR from breaches stacks?
Like if I cast two lesser spell breaches on a mage, does the SR go down by 3 or 6? (ie does the same spell stack on itself?)
Or if I cast a lesser spell breach and a greater spell breach, does the SR go down by 5 or 8? (ie does different breach spells stack?)

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I do know that Nature's Balance and Mord's stacks.

I have done this before with great results for my Puff the Magic Dragon Character (Druid/Wiz/Mk).

I do not know if Lesser Breach stacks with Lesser Breach, or if Mord's stacks with Mord's.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Just a quick update, I've playtested this guy to level 9 (Monk 1, Sorc 8).

I've followed Mick's excellent advice to go sorcerer heavy early, and it has been ok to level, much more than a pure monk build for sure.

Now that I've got a few sorc levels its getting a lot easier. 

From a gameplay point of view, there are summons, bulls strength, mage armor, shield, prot v evil, haste and I've got improved invis now.

I can hit 3 APR with flurry and 4 with haste. The spells help with AB and defense, and I can stick a damage shield up too. 


I went quarterstaff early on because I had a +2 quarterstaff drop, but have switched to fists for now, mostly for fun rather than power (although they still are quite effective).

What some of you might not be aware is there is an 'ars magus' combat style that was created as a mod. It is available in WoG (and probably in other servers too) and it looks pretty cool here, levitating and smashing things with arcane hands.

Did a bit of partying with Zanithar too. He was amused when he heard of the ECB Batman build written by myself and Demos with all the suggestions from everyone. (I attached a link in case he or others wanted to read it)


~~~

~~~

posts.content: Keep posting, I'm interested in when you hit the Epic Levels!

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
I did some testing regarding the SR decrease in NWN EE. Neither Nature's Balance nor any of the breach spells stack when it comes to reducing SR, only the highest decrease is applied.

Bear in mind that Nature's Balance can be dispelled by casting Mords, so the SR decrease from Nature's Balance can be removed by Mords and the target will end up with -10 SR even if the Nature's Balance SR decrease was higher. However multiple casts of Nature's Balance each have their own dispel check, so if you cast 3 Nature's Balance spells with an SR decrease greater than -10 then the Mords will have to dispel all 3 of those debuffs in order to reduce the SR decrease to -10.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Interesting!

Thx for checking this!
